Rethinking Childhood - Peter B. Pufall, p.8

"Active listening is a simple enough concept; it is just not as common as it might be among scholars. It is a sine qua non of interdisciplinary discussion. To listen actively is to focus intently on what the other is saying and to do so without silently framing the reply that will be offered at the earliest opportunity ... active listening involves a measure of self-transcendence, a spiritual commodity not easily come by in intellectually zealous communities."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Active Listening
